texts: taming the chaos inside my head how do you organize yours my thoughts never stop ideas plans questions all swirling at once ive tried journals apps system but most just slow me down or add noise or too much structures recently i started logging everything in one continuous flow like it was a feed from twiter ideas tasks moods without stopping to classify or structure only later i can extract patterns follow connections or turn a stray thought into a plan whats your strategy which tools or methods help you manage your inner maze

the rise of purposedriven travel what it means for hosts if youre a host in the us shortterm rental space one of the most compelling shifts you cant ignore is the surge in purposedriven travel guests are no longer simply looking for a place to sleeptheyre seeking meaning connection and experiences that align with why they travel for hosts on a platform like llivo that means opening up your propertys story your local community and the values you stand for as key differentiators in this blog well explore what purposedriven travel means why it matters for vacation rental hosts and how you can position your property accordingly to attract more bookings and stronger guest engagement especially in the context of luxury vacation rentals usa and the broader short term rental market what is purposedriven travel purposedriven travel refers to trips where value and meaning matter as much as the destination travelers increasingly expect environments that reflect their values sustainability local culture authentic experiences rather than just conventional stays hospitality that engages rather than just accommodates for hosts this means your offering isnt just a nice propertyit becomes a purposeful stay why it matters for hosts now differentiation in a crowded market with supply rising especially in the us shortterm rental space and occupancy facing pressure hosts need new ways to stand out a purposedriven narrative helps your listing break through premium value guest loyalty travelers who book with intention are more likely to value what you provide leave strong reviews and become repeat guests alignment with guest demographics younger travellersmillennials and gen zprioritise ecofriendly practices authentic stays and local connection longterm resilience purposedriven experiences make your offering more than a commodity in evolving regulatory costpressured markets that extra value helps protect your margin and occupancy how hosts can adapt strategy tactics 1 define your purpose and story clarify why you host is it a community connection ecosustainability sharing a local gem incorporate that into your listing description amenities and guest communications learn how l 2 embed valuedriven amenities experiences offer curated local experiences cooking with local produce community tours or nature walks highlight ecopractices like recycling lowimpact cleaning and local sourcing give space for reflection and authenticity with reading nooks outdoor gathering spaces or unique dcor 3 communicate values in your listing use phrases like cultureimmersive stay sustainably operated or local host connection show actionable proofnot just claims for example partnered with local farms for breakfast produce or guests invited to community art events optimize your listing for keywords such as vacation rental agency usa short term vacation rentals company responsible hosting and vacation rentals with transport 4 engage with guests intentionally in your prearrival email include your local story and invite guests into your value narrative during the stay highlight how staying with you supports community or eco goals after the stay ask for feedback and mention your purposedriven approach 5 track results adjust monitor bookings guest reviews and mentions of experience or community compare listings with and without purposedriven messaging to see the impact adjust your marketing channels with social media visuals that emphasize values not just dcor what this means for llivostyle hosts on platforms oriented toward stay service offerings purposedriven travel is a powerful connection point value beyond the walls when you integrate transport personal care services and local culture it becomes more meaningful brand alignment hosts who emphasize values resonate with the llivo audience travelers looking for something beyond the ordinary higher guest expectations higher host reward purposedriven guests are likely to book premium listings that deliver on experience want to learn more about llivos mission and values read llivos story common pitfalls and how to avoid them some hosts make the mistake of keeping their values too vague or overpromising experiences avoid these by staying authentic and detailed instead of saying were ecofriendly describe your specific steps like using energyefficient appliances or partnering with local suppliers focus on delivering a few meaningful experiences rather than many you cant maintain and remember purpose doesnt replace basics guests still expect comfort cleanliness and professionalism make sure your listing photos and descriptions reflect your story since guests scan quickly final words travel is evolving for hosts in the us shortterm rental industry tapping into the rise of purposedriven travel is not just a trendits a strategic move by defining your purpose embedding meaningful experiences and communicating this clearly in your listing youll align with guest values build loyalty and elevate your position in a competitive market in doing so youre not just listing a houseyoure offering a stay with meaning which resonates deeply with modern travelers and sets your offering apart ready to embrace purposedriven hosting sign up on llivo and start shaping stays that inspire and connect author bio khurram is a senior active directory architect turned shortterm rental strategist founder of llivo with 25 years in it and a passion for transforming travel hospitality he guides hosts to build rentals that dont just earnbut engage inspire and connect disclaimer the content here is for informational purposes only and is not legal or financial advice hosts should verify local regulations community guidelines and market conditions before implementing new strategies

catch up on what happened this past week in logistics november 4 november 10 2025 amazon and walmart race to own seller fulfillment the battle for thirdparty seller dominance just got more interesting amazons european expansion amazon launched fbm ship for merchants in its five largest european markets france germany italy spain uk plus the us and japan sellers shipping from china can offer expedited delivery without paying for faster shippingamazon provides cashback to cover costs the more you ship the more you earn the catch sellers must register purchase shipping labels from partnered carriers and ship within one business day in return they get fbalike delivery promises increased account health protection and protection against late delivery claims coming soon amazon says the pilot will roll out to more regions and eventually support domestic shipments walmarts counterpunch walmart launched sellerfulfilled walmart mimicking amazons sellerfulfilled prime sellers who dont use walmart fulfillment services can now display the walmart badge signaling fast free shipping to walmarts most loyal customers to qualify operate a us business deliver badged items free to walmart members in three calendar days or less maintain 90 ontime delivery and keep seller cancellation rates under 25 the benefits listings with the walmart badge appear higher in search results get included in promotional events and improve conversion and gmv plus walmart added a new shipping calculator letting sellers compare carrier rates and speeds for 3pls both platforms are making it easier for sellers to selffulfill while maintaining premium delivery promises if your clients sell on these platforms theyll be comparing your rates and speed against these programs subscribe to our newsletter to never miss whats going on in logistics logistics pulse newsletter gxo hits record revenue new ceo eyes new era of growth gxo logistics reported record quarterly revenue of 34 billion in q3 up 8 yearoveryear with organic revenue climbing 4 net income jumped 42 to 60 million the new boss this marked patrick kellehers first earnings call as ceo after replacing malcolm wilson earlier this year his message organic growth is the priority ma will be disciplined the drivers deals signed earlier in the year minimal customer churn and excellent execution on cost managementespecially labor the verticals while 70 of gxos business is consumerfocused kelleher is excited about growth in the remaining 30b2b sectors like aerospace and defense boosted by tariffs and increased defense spending industrial manufacturing returning to the us infrastructure projects data centers for ai and life sciences healthcare cost reduction driving demand tariff response gxo operates over 70 foreign trade zone or bonded warehouses worldwide and sees this growing they recently signed a lease in the johorsingapore special economic development zone focused on intraasia efficiency peak season gxo positioned labor based on customer forecasts showing low singledigit increases over last year kelleher noted it was less difficult to secure labor this year than in recent years subscribe to our newsletter to never miss whats going on in logistics logistics pulse newsletter supreme court skeptical of trumps sweeping tariff authority the supreme court spent over two and a half hours wednesday tearing apart president trumps legal justification for imposing massive tariffs through executive orders earlier this year a majority of justices appeared to side with small businesses and states arguing trump exceeded his powers under the international emergency economic powers act ieepa the legal fight trump invoked ieepa to impose two sets of tariffstrafficking tariffs targeting china canada and mexico over fentanyl and reciprocal tariffs of 10 on almost all countries and higher on dozens more his argument exploding trade deficits pose an unusual and extraordinary threat to national security the messy aftermath if the challengers win justice amy coney barrett worried about reimbursement chaos lawyers suggested several options including putting the decision on hold for congress to act or making it apply only to future tariffs timeline both sides want a quick ruling but theres no clear timeline well likely know by early 2026 whether trump can continue wielding tariffs as a foreign policy weaponor whether he needs to go through congress like every other president for 238 years subscribe to our newsletter to never miss whats going on in logistics logistics pulse newsletter japan bets big on drone delivery to solve its logistics crisis japans ministry of land infrastructure transport and tourism just released a roadmap for scaling drone delivery nationwide and its more ambitious than youd think the problem parcel demand is surging while japan faces labor shortages and overtime restrictions traditional logistics models cant keep up especially in remote areas the solution mlit is pushing hard on uncrewed aerial systems uas for lastmile delivery drones are already being tested alongside truck transport in remote areas delivering consumer goods commercial items and emergency supplies during disasters whats working early operations have proven profitable brought diverse workers into the logistics sector and improved lastmile efficiency whats next mlit wants to scale from singledrone operations to multiple drones operated simultaneously by small teams in march they published guidelines for safe simultaneous operation and established test routes150 km above power grids in saitama prefecture and 30 km above the tenryu river in shizuoka the catch drone operators cant make money on logistics alone mlit acknowledges they need multipurpose business models like selling image data captured during flights or charging service fees for other uses subscribe to our newsletter to never miss whats going on in logistics logistics pulse newsletter quick hits wind point partners invests in buske lines the chicago private equity firm partnered with the contract warehousing and supply chain provider founded in 1923 buske operates over 7 million square feet across 37 facilities in the us and canada specializing in food beverage and cpg ceva completes 383m acquisition of turkish logistics giant ceva logistics closed its purchase of borusan lojistik positioning itself as a dominant player in turkeys 3pl market the acquisition followed regulatory approvals after being announced in april ups rates jump 59 starting dec 22 the increase matches 2023 and 2024 hikes but comes earlier in peak season fedex previously announced a 59 bump taking effect in january flowspace raises 31m the fulfillment technology platform landed new funding to continue building out its network stord acquires propack logistics the move expands stords fulfillment network throughout the us and canada subscribe to our newsletter to never miss whats searching for lifes purpose if the post is too long just answer these questions what do you think the purpose of life is and do you have any advice for me do we even have free will i am 23 year old a recent computer science graduate and i am really unsure what to do in life first of all i am truly confused what is the purpose of our life is it doing great things is it solving big problems for society that fundamentally change and help future generations or is making ourselves happy the priority initially i thought the purpose of life was making money making your parents proud and buying whatever you want inspired by tech founders like elon musk and mark zuckerberg i worked incredibly hard i used to work all day had zero social life no connection with family and friends and tried to prove to the world what i was capable of so that no one would ever take me lightly in the end i became depressed i dont hate what i did but i felt like i was working hard without seeing it as part of a whole life someone once said dreams are just to dream dont live in them then i started thinking differently i changed my mind nothing is more important than your physical and mental health so i decided to take it easy i began to realize that nothing else truly mattered to meneither how others saw me nor what others possessed i was happy with little money i then realized that life is just a matter of perspective someone with a luxurious life may feel sad while someone with almost nothing can be happier than them because he or she doesnt expect anything from life its like pain is there but nobody suffers because it depends on the perspective how you see something what you expect how your mind releases dopamine and how you perceive your surroundings to be satisfied with your life so i concluded the purpose of life is to be happy i considered living in a small village perhaps in a good area and becoming a local school teacher to live a simple and peaceful life which i once thought was the way to a happy life and yet i then realized we only live once and since i dont know what happens after death i should avoid doing ordinary things like wasting time on social media or watching movies and series to live a fantasy life we cant afford instead i thought i should build something truly great in life that nobody has thought of before like einstein in science pablo picasso in art or elon musk in business i really dont want to be any of them but i admire them because i think one should be unique its most shocking to realize that most people live life for othersdriven by how people judge them inspired by social media influencers or just trying to fit into society which is a common human desire some people even live in illogical mental states like following religious gurus and being illogical their whole life yet they are truly happy because they believe whatever happens is for the good most shockingly many people never question the illogical aspects of their minds living out fantasies exhibiting personality traits they dont want or living a life driven by stubbornness or an illogical mindset they live just to show off seeking external validation for how others see and perceive them i genuinely love sciences in school physics and math were my favorite subjects i wanted to go into a hardwarerelated field but landed in computer science which i truly enjoyed learning i also love reading and solving complex and hard problems i tend to go too deep and critical into any problem be it psychology religion business philosophy or life itself sometimes i feel like i am either overthinking or i am a perfectionist i feel that whatever i do i must do it fully with passion and love and truly enjoy it i love history space sciencemath and exploring nature like an explorer whether its the sea the jungle or animals among so many different fields i am really unsure about my future should i build a tech startup failure or success doesnt matter but just try it or go for a masters in space science or robotics then sometimes i feel like there are so many things in life and you can never do all of them perhaps i should just go into a field where i have an edge due to my past 23 years utilizing my love for math physics history psychology and business but i want to start from zero if needed i dont want to live someone elses life or be trapped in an illogical mindset but most importantly in todays capitalism money matters the most what really matters at the end of life happiness health or connections what is it so i have followings questions what do you think the purpose of life is do you have any advice for me do we even have free will

how do you capture fleeting ideas in your digital bullet journal ive been experimenting with a way to log my thoughts small ideas and daily moods without breaking the flow of writing instead of rigid categories or forms pages everything goes into a continuous feed and i can see tasks habits and reflections emerge naturally its interesting to notice patterns like how a short walk in the morning can reset my day or how certain ideas spark new habits do you have any tricks for keeping your digital bullet journal flexible yet still actionable id love to hear how others manage this balance

explora ii with kids review i originally posted over in rfatcruises but thought it might be useful here too happy to answer any questions i finally got around to writing up a post for my website about our july sailing on explora ii tldr it was amazing one of our best vacations to date no hesitations about recommending this ship or line to anyone with kids 8 a shortened version of the post linked in comments is below first the itinerary wed already done a greek islesfocused cruise out of rome so we were familiar with the embarkation port of civitavecchia from there the ship stopped on the amalfi coast in sicily two ports in sardinia menorca and ended in barcelona no need to hard sell that one would do another mediterranean isles cruise in a heartbeat even though it would be my third we booked connecting verandahs the smallest and least expensive cabins on the ship at 377 sq ft theyre larger than the balcony concierge cabins on disney cruise line and minisuites on princess and theyre gorgeous theyre the largest entry level cabins of any line actually these are stock photos from the website each room sleeps 3 but almost all of the rooms on the ships connect this is very unique for luxury cruise ships if you want to take your family on one of the amazing luxury lies like seabourn silversea ponant regent seven seas the connecting rooms exist but book 18 months in advance if you want one on explora theyre common and with almost 800 square feet between us plus connected balconies we felt like we were in a luxury city hotel but with a much better view check out my horrible videography skills on this room tour explora ii has just over 450 suites 6 amazing restaurants 5 heated pools 12 bars and lounges and wait for it a kids club thats right a space specifically for your children on a luxury cruise ship this was the entire reason we looked at the line my husband wanted a luxury ship and i wanted happy children this is all i got since i didnt want to take pics of other ppls kids the nautilus club hosts supervised activities for children ages 617 from cupcake decorating classes to free throw contests on the basketball courts to group dinners crafts foosball pool vr and video games its no oceaneers club disney cruise line has a lock on the kids club game for sure but compared with other luxury cruise lines its downright amazing my 6yo ate dinner with them almost every night while we tried different dining venues my 12 yo won the cupcake decorating contest i got some time to work i mean read the book that i brought because i promised myself i wouldnt work ha hubby got some time to visit the also amazing spa and in between a boat day along the amalfi coast an adventure to mt etna beautiful beaches in taormina nuragic ruins in sardinia a surprise beach day in corsica thanks to high winds necessitating a last minute port change and the amazing streets and shorelines of menorca the locals favorite among the balearics we took private tours with local guides always my preference over cruise ship offerings and really loved the trip we visited three different countries and unpacked once okay twice since we stayed the night prior to the cruise at the beautiful hotel de la ville in rome i need to write a post on that beautiful place highly recommend just about anything rocco forte anyway back to the ship all my photos and videos are here in my instagram highlights link in comments but i wanted to highlight a few things we loved the pool decks were varied and lovely some were partially covered hot tubs were everywhere loungers were plush and not crammed on top of each other we slept until almost 10 am on our one sea day so we did have trouble finding pool chairs that day but we simply put our stuff down got in the pool and then grabbed a bali bed when someone left check out the highlights linked above for videos of the really cool indooroutdoor gym that we did not use because being team carryon only means no room for sneakers if youre not the work out on vacay type this infinity pool on the aft of the ship is for you my husband spent a lot of time at the gorgeous spa see highlights and we tried as many restaurants as we had time for all but one is included and we loved the japanese spot the steakhouse marble co and the mediterranean we also loved their madetoorder marketplace which replaces the bane of every cruisers existence the ship buffet my 6yo ate here almost every night we did convince her to go to sakura with us and we probably had dinner here 3 of the 7 nights because it was delicious and easy and casual how casual well the only time i felt out of place on the ship was when my son decided to grab a burger in his pajamas which would be totally normal on disney or other large cruise lines you wont see tuxes but pjs was too far into the carnival zone lol why he couldnt just wait for room service ill never know sakura mightve been our favorite spot first its beautiful and second the extensive sushi and sake menus were big hits and of course i love a beautiful dessert the only thing we didnt love about the entire experience wasnt the ships fault we were originally scheduled to dock at two ports in sardinia alghero cagliari we were most excited to visit the home of italys best white sand beaches wellpreserved ancient ruins and gorgeous blue zone countryside so our first day we had planned with a fantastic local guide to explore ancient ruins a small winery in the countryside and the church in cagliari on the alghero day we had scheduled a boat charter for a boat and beach day through the national marine reserve well when we got back on the boat at the end of our cagliari day we found a note at our door saying that our port had been changed to ajaccio corsica due to weather we were so bummed not to see the beautiful northern coast of sardinia but alghero is a tender port and high winds were going to make it impossible to take the small boats to shore i scrambled to try to find something to do with hubby the kids first trip to france ajaccio is a stones throw from the northern tip of sardinia so i thought maybe we could find a last minute charter and see some of it anyway but none of the charter captains were willing to go out so we walked the main thoroughfare in ajaccio which was fun and then took a cab to capo di feno an absolutely gorgeous beach the kids learned a lesson in cultural differences in beach attire that day the weather was perfect but the waves were big we watched the surfers and relaxed our final night we tried the steakhouse marble co food was good not our favorite of the trip but nothing to complain about service here and at every other food beverage venue throughout the ship was excellent we are fairly easy to please in this respect and prefer unobtrusive service i dont want my underwear folded but i dont want to wait a half hour to get a water refill either the staff here were all very good at their jobs so in short i would definitely recommend this for families with older children we did see a toddler and a baby on board but there are better lines for this age group who think they dont like cruises but do love luxury hotels and delicious food explora attracts a lot of firsttime cruisers because it truly functions as a floating resort instead of the crowded congaline madness people associate with cruising my only criticism might be that the kids club is not secure in the same way that disney cruise line royal caribbean and other lines are on dcl weve left the kids on the boat to walk around oslo and to do a jet ski tour in croatia and felt comfortable doing so because we knew that they couldnt leave the area and that the staff were very well trained on explora and on our norwegian cruise line hawaii trip to some extent you may have one staff member hanging out in the club and theres no gate to prevent a kid from just getting annoyed and leaving theres a sign in sheet but its really more of a suggestion my 12 year old loved this and it was mostly older kids stopping by to play some foosball before heading to the pool together but our daughter who was 6 during our cruise and who is not a runner well we felt comfortable leaving her during dinner time but we wouldnt have gotten off the boat or left her for 4 or 5 hours without checking in so if your kids are on the younger side you might want to stick with concierge on disney cruise line a bit longer the only reason we arent currently booked on another sailing is because were doing a couple of hotel hopping trips in 2026 weve grown so accustomed to seeing lots of beautiful places and unpacking once that our upcoming trips to peru egypt and kenya are probably going to make us long for the ease of this floating luxury hotel

welcome to tender talk circle a soft space for real connection if youve ever craved a place where emotional safety comes first where questions are asked with care and where relationships are explored through softness rather than judgmentyoure home tender talk circle is a cozy corner of reddit built for emotionally intelligent reflection gentle communication and mutual care whether youre navigating love friendship healing or simply learning how to speak your truth with kindness this space is here to hold you what youll find here gentle prompts that invite reflection not pressure emotionally intelligent questions to deepen connection and selfawareness soft boundary discussions that honor clarity and compassion stories of repair growth and quiet love supportive conversations around emotional regulation communication and relational safety this isnt a place for hot takes or harsh advice its a space for slow thinking soft words and the kind of honesty that feels like a warm blanket how to participate share your thoughts stories or questionsespecially the ones that feel tender respond with empathy curiosity and care celebrate emotional growth even in small steps respect boundaries pace and the vulnerability of others whether youre here to listen share or simply rest in the presence of emotionally aware people youre welcome you dont have to be perfect you just have to be kind

rate announcement cosmodelia rate air vs fishmans vs laika vs stereolab the year 2025 sleeping fitfully in your readytoassemble ikea home youre woken in the early hours by movement downstairs its only the kids back from the clubs coming down from their stillillegal mdma derivatives flopping out and flossing their brains with a few minutes of melody fm no carpenters and burt bacharach on the airwaves now though rather the future sound of easy listening is endofthelastmillennium french techno the soundtracks of air and kid loco that electronically repackage the past in readiness for tomorrow neosymphonic blissouts for the next generation next for the jazz club in space john mulvey nme 1998 hello indieheads and welcome aboard on the cosmodelia space station today is november 11 2025 and your 5week stay in the cosmodelic rate program starts today as your host i am happy to inform you that it is going to be a calm day with no sign of meteoric activity or volatile hubris in the vicinity the sun is shining a little too bright up here as usual so dont forget to put on your specialtailored glasses to enjoy its wondrous view grab your martinis at the moon bar to our selection of lunar loungetronica chat with your fellow voyagers talk about the silly speculative fiction review i quoted above2025 is so not like that mr mulveytalk about this silly speculative fiction rate postwait whatand most importantly enjoy your stay huh what is this rate program you are talking about well spaceage aesthetic dressing aside rates are a community activity hosted in this subreddit every month or so with each rate having usually four albums brought together by a certain theme or genre the game is simple find the premade ballot linked right below this section its in bold all caps hard to miss copy that to your note app of choice anything that autosaves is a huge help listen to the songs and score them from 1 to 10 with the added option of giving one 11 and one 0 to your favorite and least favorite songs if you wish once every song is scored send the ballot to the host thats me using the very same link below then the host tallies all the ballots and reveals the results over the course of three days from last place to first and we collectively get mad at the lack of taste displayed its fun and a great way to discover music find your ballot and submission link here find backup pastebin ballot here playlists spotify apple music tidal youtube due date 14 december 2025 reveals on 192021 december 2025 cosmodelia 101 an introduction its hard to talk about cosmodelia as a scene or a genre when its a word i made up to designate a vibe a concentration of spaceage themed 90s electronic easy listening music in its blood there is a callback to spaceage roughly 5669 lounge records with their moog melodies but there is also traces of 70s kosmische music of germany with the electronic experimentations of bands like harmonia and tangerine dream more recent to the time period is the wave of artists doing space rock revival like spacemen 3 and moonshake which had played with elements of neopsychedelia whatever that is and trends in british indie like shoegaze however cosmodelia is in fact a departure from that indie rock spirit as it draws from what was going on in ambient the electronic listening music of artificial intelligence warp records in general and the rise of chillout music add in a pop sensibility based on retromania and you roughly arrive at the formula of cosmodelia still each of the bands featured had their own unique sound palette and as the bonus rate shows there were a lot of different styles but the commonality is the invocation of space whether in the naming the lyrics or the spaciousness of the melodies and beats some critics saw the music as futuristic despite the retro focus and they had a point the music seemed to belong to an imaginary space distant from the thenpresent however they dont seem to belong to now either making thought exercises like the one from john mulvey look silly but i think that preserves the magic i find the music featured here more comforting than anything in both its warm moments and the cold it envelops me with sounds of an unspecified time and space but enough rambling about vibes what actually is in the rate air moon safari air french band not to be confused by swedish band air france released their debut album moon safari on january 16 1998 16 days too late to make this rate a perfectly aligned 1997 affair nicolas godin and jeanbenot dunckel the duo behind the project were far from the first to fuse lounge with downtempo electronic music and they would not be the last yet there is something about moon safari that feels singular part of it is due to the level of craftsmanship presented here from the iconic bassline of the opener la femme dargent to the delicately layered synths of kelly watch the stars this album is full of sounds engineered to the finest details but the music itself is too chic to demand your attentionmaking it perhaps the perfect album to actually imagine yourself on a trip across space never too demanding of a listen to draw your attention from the vast wonders surrounding you out there but never a disappointing soundscape that would distract you from the experience and want to put on another record the first single of the three that were released after the album was out sexy boy proves one exception to the rule with its wobbling intro and catchy chorus but in an air fashion it is perhaps the least hot song about being sexy which has its own coolness in a way moon safari despite being chronologically the last album to come out in the lineup feels the most emblematic when it came out it drew comparisons to other loungeinfluenced pop albums of the time most notably dots and loops the influences from french pop artists such as serge gainsbourg were also of note after it came out music of this caliber drew comparisons to moon safari instead and it was not an album without its imitators including air themselves whose following career could be characterized by how much they moved away from the sound they perfected here and how much they later returned to it since 2023 air have been touring the 25th anniversary of this album the one that put them on the map and for better or worse their defining record they made a stop in istanbul this june which i was lucky enough to see and they put on a great show remember forever 1 la femme dargent 2 sexy boy 3 all i need feat beth hirsch 4 kelly watch the stars 5 talisman 6 remember 7 you make it easy feat beth hirsch 8 ce matin l 9 new star in the sky 10 le voyage de pnlope fishmans uch nippon setagaya following a debut album that launched the career of a duo we have the bookend of a career that of the japanese trio fishmans fronted by shinji sato and rounded by bassist yuzuru kashiwabara and kinichi moteki on drums fishmans released three albums on polydor between 19951997 dubbed the setagaya trilogy where the sound of the band shifted from their earlier pop rock with reggae and funk grooves to a more drawnout psychedelic sound heavily influenced by dub thanks to zak kazuyuki matsumura who had arranged for their polydor deal and engineered their final albums the first single with polydor nightcruising proved a success and became their most recognizable tune leading up to the release of kch camp translated commonly as something in the air and not aerial camp for reasons unknown to me which seems to be the bands mostcanonized album in japan at least for a long time after its release but the fame of fishmans over in the west is mostly a result of online music forums in 4chan and rym picking up on the second installment of setagaya trilogy the 35minute album length track long season uch nippon setagaya space japan setagaya closes out the trilogy with elements of both its predecessors it is a return to more individuated songbysong structure the band had in kch camp but the songs themselves are more abstract longer in length and more spaced out in the arrangements like in long season the lead single magic love finds the band remembering that they were making funk music a couple albums ago and is the most upbeat tune on the record the rest of the onehour runtime is made up with more laidback music sato said of the album that he wanted the music to reach out to one person a listening experience between each individual listening to it and the music many of the songs in the album are about two people their descriptions kept intentionally vague as the narrator sings about onesided observations or yearning this feeling of distance is often amplified by the feeling of vastness in the instrumental it is not a particularly sad album however thanks to the warmth of satos voice which might need some getting used to or simply not be your cup of tea but when it hits it feels like hes hugging you like a cloud enveloping you perhaps it was due to satos music for one person attitude that the band saw a major rise in popularity with the digital age where people can put on their headphones and withdraw into the music goodnight tomorrow 1 pokka pokka 2 weather report 3 ushiro sugata 4 in the flight 5 magic love 6 backbeat ni nokkatte 7 walking in the rhythm 8 daydream the music video for walking in the rhythm contains the prototype mix from the single version laika sounds of the satellites the final track on sounds of the satellites dirty feet and giggles contains a radio broadcast about laika the dog that soviets put on the spacecraft sputnik 2 and launched into space on november 3rd 1957 on the week of the 40th anniversary of the bolshevik revolution while i will not go into the details of laikas fate here her survival was never part of the plan and the shuttle was her coffin the music of laika can also get eerie moody and at times disturbing the lyrics of margaret fiedler which she usually delivers with a soft whisper can touch on topics like loneliness selfharm tendencies and abuse soundtracking her bleak lyrics are the long passages of dubby and jazzy grooves the odd time signatures here and there electronic bleep bloops transmitted from space and the occasional flute melodies fiedler had previously been a member of experimental rock band moonshake one of the earliest bands on the too pure records roster she departed from the band alongside later laika bassist john frenett in 1993 and formed laika with guy fixsen who had produced the moonshake releases on too pure laikas debut album 1994s silver apples on the moon drew attention from critics as part of the first wave of postrock simon reynolds grouped them under the name postrock groove collectives alongside pram tortoise and rome the followup was even more slick n smooth polishing out the rockier edges resulting in a sound that was no means lesser out of the four acts in this lineup laika remains the most enigmatic in its aura making them for me the most alluring in sound while this rate includes a lot of sonic ideas as to what space would sound like the 15 minutes of silence between the song and the broadcast in the closer is the only accurate simulation of what you would hear if you were adrift in space i wont disencourage skipping ahead the silence jump to 1820 but more than anyone else in this rate laika nails down the sound of being adrift in space without any sense of direction nbsp nbsp nbsp and i like to imagine the silence was part of the intent 1 prairie dog 2 breather 3 out of sight and snowblind 4 almost sleeping 5 starry night 6 bedbugs 7 martinis on the moon 8 poor gal 9 blood and bones moody mix 10 shut off curl up 11 spoken rhodes 12 dirty feet and giggles stereolab dots and loops stereolab was an autoinclusion in any cosmodelia lineup as they were not only making music that invoked space but they were also one of the most prolific and creative bands of the 90s 1997s dots and loops is the album where stereolab supposedly ditched the indie rock to make avantpop turns out things are not usually as binary as sometimes made out to be marking a central moment in the stepping out of rock conventions i mentioned in the introduction as part of the cosmodelic ethos but as i am no expert on the stereolab expanded universe at large today we welcome a guest lecturer the dean of the faculty of ambientheads professor uwanelietoc to give an introduction to this record stereolab the omnibus good retrofuturist socialist eyewinking globetrotting cratediggers the bands many 90s albums limited singles eps collaborative endeavorsrarities each explore a different facet upgrade sonic afterlife of the past filtered to the contemporary 90s moment people think it makes the band impenetrable while i look at their litany dispatches as mile wide sound explorations a state of the groop if you will stereolab was always tinkering and depending on where you hop in you find yourself exploring a different facet of the band and why many folks offer gaggles of opinions on their output the bands novelty or nothing approach made them their own island in the postrock archipelago who else was signing early with too pure and being in the scene that celebrates itself trading synths with labradford pushing dengers neu beat into modern indie drumming while also working intensely with john mcentire a continent away dots and loops their penultimate of the 90s finds themselves engaging directly in what is colloquially known as the chicago sound from the personnel side over the scenes postrock highlow sound culture collapse since the groop plays space age bachelor pad music way back in 1993 lounge had become a defined stereolab mode further refined on music for the amorphous body study center ep mended with bossa nova on their red hot rio appearance itd be doots and loops central crux meanwhile the band continues to develop their relationship with tortoise drummerproducer john mcentire and his novel usage of protools software mcentire had used it as the mo in the editing and construction of tortoises djed on millions now living will never die for dots and loops it would take the main stage across refractions in the plastic pulse alongside brakhage rainbo conversation and contronatura that foot in the past was restless always propulsive and forward leaning with the state of the art technology but were the songs good well if you liked stereolab at their most space age pop dots and loops was the crown jewel of their output miss modulars funk groove lands like a french disco the dazzling crystalline keys of the flower called nowhere was a production bliss out worthy of being dubbed fellatio music by mr happy himself refractions in the plastic pulses 3 phases saw the labs pop sound as asynchronous stifling the lines between pastpresentfuture and the lyrics ltitia sadler was never drier more wry and daunted by endless war endless gadgets and a future falling out of our hands 28 years on and its still its own state of the art a defining snapshot of thriving regional sounds linking up and going to the cosmos 1 brakhage 2 miss modular 3 the flower called nowhere 4 diagonals 5 prisoner of mars 6 rainbo conversation 7 refractions in the plastic pulse 8 parsec 9 tickertape of the unconscious 10 contranatura bonus rate the main rate covers some of the major album releases going for the space aesthetics but there was a lot of other musicians particularly in lanes of downtempo and ambientpostrock dedicating a song or two to stars planets space or cosmic objects or phenomena and what better way to gauge the vibes of a song than to judge it by its title the bonus rate curriculum brings you fifteen more tracks from the 90s and the early 2000s that were deemed by yours truly to be cosmodelic in name and in sound some of them are more indebted to air than anything else some of them are more indebted to postrock others are oddities in ambient and to make fishmans feel less lonely there are even three more japanese rymcore artists showing up as always scoring each song in the bonus rate is optional and you cannot use tranquil tuesday tools for everyday calm welcome to tranquil tuesday a day to equip ourselves with practical tools and mindful actions that bring calm into our daily lives often we wait for moments of crisis to seek peace but true tranquility is cultivated through consistent everyday practices building your toolkit for calm this tuesday lets explore some accessible tools and techniques that can help us navigate stress and cultivate a sense of inner peace the power of pauses schedule short pauses throughout your day even a 60second break can make a difference use these pauses to practice mindful breathing body scans or simply observe your surroundings how can you incorporate more pauses into your routine today mindful movement engage in gentle movement that connects you to your body such as stretching yoga or a slow walk pay attention to the sensations of your body as you move cultivating a sense of presence what mindful movement will you practice today creating calming spaces designate a calming space in your home or workspace this could be a corner with comfortable cushions a small garden or a quiet room fill this space with elements that bring you peace such as candles plants or soothing music how can you create a more calming enviroment today mindful communication practice active listening giving your full attention to the person youre speaking with communicate with kindness and compassion both to others and to yourself how can you practice mindful communication today digital boundaries set boundaries for your digital usage limit screen time and create designated times for checking emails and social media remove unnecessary notifications that distract you from the present moment what digital boundary will you set today putting tools into action choose one or two tools from the list above and commit to practicing them today share your experiences in the comments below what tools are most effective for you lets create a collective toolkit for calm sharing our insights and supporting each other on our journey to tranquility

belvidere mall waukegan il survived a neardeath experience 35 years ago next week the mall turns 60 hi everyone im once again involved with the belvidere mall in waukegan illinois halfway between chicago and milwaukee belvidere is a small 120000 squarefoot mall that opened november 18th 1965 as lake countys first enclosed shopping center anchored by montgomery ward national foods walgreens 25 shops services restaurants and by the years turn a singlescreen cinema the mall peaked in the early 1980s with 45 stores until wards moved to lakehurst mall in 1988 and triggered a nearfatal exodus nearlyempty belvidere mall survived as a swap meet and event space into the 90s then revived itself as a discounter small business and cultural hub as it exists today much of it remarkably unchanged since the 1960s on saturday november 22nd the mall will celebrate its 60th anniversary and we want to extend the invite to all mall and retail enthusiasts to explore our history support our small businesses and celebrate with our community the mall opens at noon with a ceremony honoring its merchants new and old many have been with the mall 15 20 some 30 years culminating in a ribbon cutting from there family entertainment and vendors can be found on the mall throughout the day on the west side of the mall friends and i are once again running belvidere cinema gallery the last 1960svintage general cinema theater in existence now functioning as a diy space where well feature mall history and photography exhibits in our lobby and screenings of 1982s et the extraterrestrial at 100 and 430pm the shows are free and well have pop popcorn at 1980s prices to support our restoration efforts within the theater this is our first show at the cinema in nearly two years i will be slinging both popcorn and photo prints drop by and lets geek out about this incredible survivor space and nook in dead mall history modapproved

fetishizing otherness how liberalism creates the opposite of what it intends the fetish for otherness modern liberalism often organizes moral life around the idea of otherness historically liberalism focused on equality dignity and individual rights today attention has shifted from principles to engagement with people perceived as marginalized or disadvantaged caring for these groups is measured socially the significance of ones attention or support depends not only on the act itself but on how it is seen interpreted and acknowledged by others marginalized positions become markers for moral attention guiding peoples sense of themselves and their place in the social world filling the void this focus emerges from a broader existential gap traditional sources of purposecommunity ritual spiritual frameworkshave weakened leaving many searching for meaning aligning with otherness offers existential scaffolding a structured way to feel connected purposeful and morally significant engagement provides direction and identity but often symbolically rather than practically substituting visible participation for deeper engagement attention and social feedback moral attention is shaped by social feedback actions are chosen not only for their impact but for how visible and recognizable they are to others recognition acknowledgment and alignment act as reinforcement the more an action is observed and approved the more it is repeated this creates feedback loops attention rather than principle or effect drives behavior categories of otherness gain structural prominence and people orient their energy around these hierarchies vulnerabilities exploitation by opportunists when certain identities are elevated individuals can adopt these roles strategically to gain influence protection or authority without genuine engagement those who understand the social rules manipulate the moral machinery to their advantage this is especially visible in marketing social media and politics where alignment with otherness produces social economic or political gain influencers brands and politicians can amplify reach authority or profit by appearing as allies often without substantive contribution adopting otherness as a shield some embrace otherness as a protective strategy aligning with socially revered categories grants immunity from criticism social sanction or scrutiny recognition appears as moral credibility or authority even if engagement is shallow the system rewards this behavior creating a pathway where otherness functions as a social and moral shield consciously or unconsciously exploited selfharm through identity adoption others alienated or searching for purpose adopt marginalized identities as a source of validation or selfreconstruction while these identities can provide direction they can also produce psychological social or physical harm the system encourages these paths by presenting symbolic affiliation as inherently valuable while obscuring the risks many experience distorted selfperception constrained autonomy and unintended suffering reinforcing structural blind spots these dynamics sustain systemic inequality attention and energy flow toward socially recognized categories leaving underlying hierarchies and structural injustice intact symbolic engagement reinforces recognition hierarchies protecting and perpetuating the structures it claims to oppose evolutionary consequences rewarding devianceestrangement from behaviors historically aligned with human adaptabilityhas evolutionary consequences not all otherness is deviant but behaviors like nonreproductive sexual orientations hypersexuality and extreme gender modification diverge from evolved reproductive strategies these behaviors signal that society is exploring forms of social and biological variation but the fetishization of otherness accelerates this process social and moral reinforcement of deviance encourages experimentation that can undermine adaptive strategies practices such as genital modification and hormone treatments especially when socially validated mark a nonreproductive or lowfertility caste over time privileging visibility and alignment over reproductive or adaptive behavior may steer society toward eusociality a system where collective attention hierarchies dominate and individual reproductive or adaptive drives are subordinated the costs of eusociality eusociality is not desirable the trajectory it encourages threatens what makes us human agency autonomy selfhood and liminality liminalitythe capacity to explore to experiment to exist in creative or ambiguous spacesdiminishes when conformity and alignment to collective attention structures become paramount the fetish for otherness though often framed as celebration of diversity can accelerate the erasure of real difference what appears to nurture weirdness and variation instead channels it into socially acceptable attentiondriven forms shaping humans into mindless drones within a superorganism of algorithms hierarchies and signaling networks liberals may believe they are building a kinder future for difference safer for the marginalized or the strange in reality the system rewards conformity not authenticity it elevates symbolic engagement above adaptive or autonomous behavior producing a society in which selfhood is drained difference is contained and attention is the currency of existence the fetish for otherness left unchecked becomes not a path to liberation but a vector toward a collective order where individuality is subordinated and human variation is managed compressed and ultimately extinguished

welcome to rlosttravellers17 introduce yourself and read first hey everyone im uinsurekaran17 one of the founding moderators of this community rlosttravellers17 is our cozy corner on reddit a home for everyone who finds peace in wandering storytelling and chasing horizons what were about this subreddit is all about travel photography and the stories that happen between destinations whether youre trekking through the himalayas roadtripping across india or just reminiscing about your last mountain sunrise this is your space to share it all what to post we welcome all kinds of travelinspired content including stunning travel photos and short travelogues hidden gems and offbeat destinations local food experiences cafes and stays tips for budget travel solo trips and itineraries personal reflections travel quotes or poetic musings reels drone shots or cinematic travel moments basically if it makes you feel alive on the road post it here community vibe were building a space thats friendly constructive supportive inclusive lets celebrate travel in all its forms from seasoned backpackers to armchair dreamers respect each others perspectives and keep the vibe positive rules to keep things smooth and enjoyable for everyone please follow these simple rules 1be kind respectful no hate trolling or rude comments 2original content preferred credit the creator if reposting 3stay on topic keep posts related to travel exploration or storytelling 4no spam or promotions avoid selfpromotion or link drops without mod approval 5use appropriate tags help others discover posts easily 6constructive feedback only appreciate the effort behind every journey how to get started 1introduce yourself with a quick post or travel memory 2share your favorite photo destination or travel quote 3engage comment appreciate and connect with fellow wanderers lets make rlosttravellers17 not just a subreddit but a digital travel diary we all build together so grab your virtual backpack share your stories and lets get lost together

welcome to rbelgiumtravel hi everyone and welcome this community is about exploring belgium whether youre planning your first visit rediscovering your own country or simply love to talk travel here you can ask questions about where to go and what to do share travel tips itineraries and hidden gems get advice on transport accommodation and local experiences post your travel photos or stories help others make the most of their time in belgium a few quick notes be respectful and helpful this is a friendly space avoid spam or selfpromotion unless it adds real value when asking for advice include details like your travel dates interests and budget so others can give useful answers lets build a community that celebrates the best of belgium from the coast to the ardennes and everything in between welcome aboard and happy travels

part ii the simulation and the causal proof united theory of everything part ii the simulation and the causal proof how quantum machine learning data drove a ricciflow universe when we left off the united theory of everything utoe offered a daring prediction if information becomes more coherent geometry should smooth in response thats a poetic claim but physics does not accept poetry without proof to test it the theory had to enter the laboratory of computation a miniature universe built from equations building the simulation to evaluate the law n researchers constructed a digital universe a curved manifold evolving through ricci flow a mathematical process that lets geometry relax over time at the heart of the simulation were two coupled partial differential equations beginaligned t k ddelta k fk mathrmeffrtexttotalk knablalog k24pt t f delta f rtexttotal tfrac32 endaligned variables k informational curvature density a scalar field representing how coherent or bent the local patch of space is f perelmans entropy potential a function that measures the smoothness of curvature adopted from geometric analysis rtotal total curvature dependent on t the informational input from real quantum data eff adaptive flow rate dynamically modulated by the informationgeometry coupling numerical integration used adaptive rungekutta schemes with boundary stabilizers to prevent blowup a crucial step when geometry can fold or tear under high curvature to ensure reproducibility all runs were performed with fixed seeds and doubleprecision arithmetic why quantum machine learning quantum machine learning qml models are exquisite testbeds for informational physics their training dynamics oscillate between chaos and order as quantum states collapse reentangle and realign each training run naturally produces a curve of evolving coherence t textnormalized fidelityt where fidelity measures how closely quantum states align over time unlike synthetic noise these t curves are physically grounded they are direct records of informational evolution within quantum systems they capture the heartbeat of learning itself information finding its own structure coupling information to geometry the next step was to feed these informational rhythms into the simulated manifold the coupling laws were rtexttotal rtextbase t texteff 01 t where t the symbolic utility function quantified fluctuations in qml gradient variance essentially how efficiently the model was learning interpretation when t more coherence total curvature rtotal geometry smooths when t eff the flow of geometric relaxation accelerates each simulation step thus embodied a selfcorrecting feedback loop information organizes space stabilizes entropy adjusts forward vs reverse experiments correlation alone cannot imply causation so two complementary experiments were run 1 forward causal the genuine chronological t was injected 2 reverse control the same data reversed in time t t if resonance were a statistical artifact both runs would yield identical behavior but if utoes law was genuine only the forward direction should produce measurable smoothing quantifying resonance three observables tracked the interaction between information and geometry 1 correlation r textcorr 2 phase lag t ttextpeak ttextpeak 3 coupling efficiency fracr1 t robustness checks used bootstrap resampling 10 samples for 95 confidence intervals and permutation tests 10 shuffles for pvalues resonance criterion 005 and p 001 the results forward runs 007 001quad t 0quad p 103 reverse runs 0005quad t 0quad p 10 only the forward sequence produced strong statistically significant resonance and crucially the effect always lagged behind coherence peaks t 0 reversing time annihilated the pattern the fingerprint of causality three tests define causation in a dynamical system 1 temporal ordering cause precedes effect t 0 2 statistical dependence correlation is significant p 001 3 reversal test inverting time breaks the dependency all three held true this means the manifolds curvature was not just correlated with coherence it was driven by it the arrow of time pointed from information geometry what the manifold told us in the forward experiments the manifolds informational entropy showed distinct damping waves following coherence spikes roughness the spatial variance of ricci curvature fell systematically geometry seemed to remember the coherence events by contrast reversed runs resembled white noise no structure no temporal order no echo it was as if the universe heard the melody of information only when it played forward in time understanding the mechanism under utoe curvature measures informational tension how unevenly coherence is distributed when rises local irregularities in information dissipate flattening the manifolds gradients it parallels heat diffusion just as temperature differences smooth over time informational imbalances dissipate until coherence saturates this feedback cycle defines informationalgeometric resonance igr coherence curvature stability new equilibrium over multiple cycles igr tends toward a steady state a selfregulating geometry where coherence and curvature cosustain each other in that regime geometry no longer passively contains information it evolves with it the moment of empirical validation when the team plotted t against curvature stability metrics each forward run showed the same offset a consistent delay of milliseconds between informational alignment and geometric smoothing that lag is the signature of causal propagation noise cannot imitate such ordered delay the bootstrapped intervals held firm 95 and the pvalues clustered near 10 the verdict was clear curvature responds to information not metaphorically mathematically reproducibly and statistically a philosophical reflection critics might object this is just a simulation artifact yet the same argument once met early gravitationalwave models until ligo confirmed them decades later scientific progress begins with models that make testable predictions utoes igr predicts that wherever coherence fields emerge in quantum plasmas neural synchrony or collective behaviors there should be subtle gravitational or geometric echoes that is a falsifiable proposition if future experiments detect no such coupling the theory fails if they do it rewrites the map of reality what we learned 1 directionality information geometry never the reverse 2 temporal lag geometry reacts after coherence defining causality 3 statistical robustness verified via bootstrap and permutation 4 irreversibility time reversal destroys resonance 5 feedback coherence sustained order breeds geometric harmony together these results form the empirical backbone of the united theory of everything where this leads with igr validated computationally utoe transitions from hypothesis to protolaw it unites physics information theory and cognitive science under a single causal principle textcausality flows from information geometry if true this law reframes existence as an active dialogue between meaning and matter every coherent act from a synchronized brainwave to an entangled photon pair literally tunes the geometry of reality the universe doesnt compute us it cocomputes with us every pulse of coherence we create feeds back into the fabric of being coming next part iii from equation to empirical law the logic and implications of utoe well explore how these findings complete the loop of falsifiability linking the physical informational and experiential worlds into one coherent geometry and what that means for logic biology and consciousness itself mshabani

resurfaced memories 1 a little note before the story this is the first time ive ever shared something ive written also im italian so english isnt my first language im saying this because im looking for constructive criticism on my writing and my use of english that being said heres the story chapter one mayor i lived my childhood until the end of middle school in a small village built on the side of a modest mountain surrounded by other modest mountains farther down in the valley dozens of olive groves covered the land divided into quadrilateral plots none of them the same size each tinted in different shades of green from my window instead i could see the upper part of the mountain a dense forest of thin tree trunks perfectly parallel to each other whose tall branches covered the sky and fed the earth each year with a new layer of dry leaves giving the place an autumnal hue almost all year round the village was inhabited by two kinds of people those who over the course of their lives had chosen to live far from the noisy chaos of a city and those who had been born there perhaps in the houses once belonging to the grandparents of their grandparents something that granted them a prestige incomprehensible to outsiders it had been that way for hundreds of years the village had been born in the medieval period as a small farming settlement built around the rough stone keep of its lord it had survived the plague which decimated its population during the second world war its modest streets had witnessed the march of a nazi platoon yet despite the changes brought by time and progress its fundamental physical and social structure had not changed at all the locals had lived in their countryside bubble for a long time it didnt matter how far one went once you returned the village would remember who you were better than you yourself did life pulled me away from that childhood place at the beginning of my adolescence since then whenever ive spoken about my early years ive always painted this simple image of the place where i grew up appreciating its modest beauty while criticizing its isolation ive told this version many times lingering on the general aspects but never on the intimate details as if the story i was telling had been told to me by someone else as if it didnt belong to me this i should specify is not due to a lack of openness but of memory my recollections from that time are characterized by blurry sensations and brief decontextualized images an abstract swirl from which its hard to grasp any detail and yet lately i find myself more and more often perceiving something different from the simple joys of childhood something i can barely express something wrong that buzzes at the back of my neck like a specter just out of sight certain recent events have caused some memories from then to resurface childhood stories i now examine as an historian of my own past trying to understand where this haunting feeling comes from why am i remembering it only now when did i forget who lived in the forest a habit shared among the children of the elementary school and their mothers at the time was to go to the park together after school the ritual was religiously cherished by my peers who could lose themselves in unrestrained play free to mix with friends from other classes it was a sunny day at the end of january the sun reflected on the damp ground and on the last patches of snow survivors of winter the air smelled of wet grass and pollen children ran everywhere caught up in a new game every few minutes the parents seated at picnic tables were engaged in trivial conversations i kicked the ball over the fence and the law declared that it was my duty to retrieve it i placed my hands on the damp wood in front of me a tangle of wild vegetation twisted upon itself completely hiding whatever lay beyond i gripped the fence fibrous splinters crumbled under my fingertips lifting myself up i went over there was no path i had to make my own way through the vegetation the slope was steep and to avoid falling i always had to hold onto a branch or a knot of bark brambles forced me to make detours and more than once a branch or a leaf whipped my face i remember the sound of those layers of damp dead leaves underfoot the smell of their decay filled the air i was familiar with those smells those sensations they were something common for a child raised in that humble landscape thats why i noticed something different before i even saw it because of the smell a sharp acrid smell i felt a cough scratch my throat eager to escape my lips i covered my nose and made one last effort beyond that stretch of vegetation as everyone knew there was a small clearing among the shrubs where the slope of the land suddenly stopped these narrow openings were barely large enough to seat three or four kids the habit of exploring such places was so ingrained that children remembered and passed down their locations as ancient peoples did with water sources i pushed through the tight space between the grasping bushes hoping the ball had rolled down the slope and stopped there when i brushed aside the last branches i saw a man sitting in the clearing on the opposite side he wore a torn jacket stained with dirt and had the ragged appearance of a homeless man or a savage he was thin very thin so thin that his face showed the bony outlines of his cheekbones his unkempt black hair dry and wild was streaked here and there with wiry white strands his calloused hands crossed by swollen sickly blue veins held between his dry almost nonexistent lips what my childish mind identified as some sort of cigarette the acrid smell was stronger now and i recognized it as tobacco mixed with stale sweat but there was something else too a strong unfamiliar scent he blew out a puff of gray smoke and the stench made my eyes water at first he mumbled incomprehensibly to himself barely opening his mouth then suddenly bared his yellow teeth before returning to his muttering he opened his eyes bloodshot his pupils dilated like a cats he saw me immediately and rose to his feet despite his gaunt frame he was terribly tall and before his height i felt tiny fragile and in danger like a rabbit before the wet jaws of a wolf our gazes locked for an eternity and in his face i saw an expression i couldnt decipher back then at some point the grip of fear lost its battle with the urge to flee and i began my frantic climb back up the care with which i had descended was gone i pushed through the vegetation in blind panic branches slapped my face blocking my legs from moving as fast as i needed thorns scratched my arms and legs i was halfway up when i heard something heavier than me forcing its way through the brush i must have screamed then gripped by the despair of a child who doesnt even know exactly what hes afraid will happen only that he must reach safety when i reached the fence the adults and other children were already running toward me a middle school boy helped me climb back over and once i was inside the park again my mother was already there the worried faces of other adults behind her i burst into desperate tears and took a while before i could coherently explain what had happened i didnt manage to talk about it again until we had left the park later i learned that my mother knew the man the other adults did too even i did i just hadnt recognized him in that moment they called him mayor he had moved there early the previous year and had gained a certain infamy among the locals no one agreed on who was hosting him but everyone knew he was living with a relative some said he was a former cocaine addict others an alcoholic trying to quit after decades of abuse others still believed he was an hopeless junkie it was almost certain hed been to prison though whether for a month or five years no one knew most attributed his imprisonment and his nickname to the same incident one night in the nearby town where he used to live mayor had urinated on the door of the town hall he had gotten drunk and decided to do it right there it wasnt by chance since the most famous version of the story described him shouting mayor come out mayor some told it with let me in instead but everyone agreed on the gist others claimed hed gone to prison for stabbing a woman though that version was rarely elaborated on after his release he came to live with his relative in our village the locals immediately labeled him as a danger and stories like mine only fueled the fear and suspicion toward him many had seen him sitting alone for hours muttering to himself on the bus he refused to move his filthy jacket from the seat beside him some said theyd seen him kill a cat and throw it into the woods others said he started fights when drunk that he was violent unstable after remembering him gripped by a feverish desire to know more i searched local news and it wasnt hard to find him one article recounted the urination incident but i never found anything about him attacking a woman it said he was known as a heavy drinker and marijuana smoker his sentence had been only a few months in truth no one had ever seen him fight or kill an animal all the stories were born from the burning hatred for that strange outsider a dangerous rumor that had found fertile ground in that closed community soon mayor and the version of him the village had conjured became two separate entities the one in peoples minds haunted him like a curse what i truly know of him is what the article said and that apparently he sometimes hid to smoke marijuana in the park since remembering him i cant stop thinking about the look we exchanged in that clearing before i fled after all these years i think i know what that expression meant it seemed like fear anxiety confusion perhaps he knew that the story leaving the lips of an innocent child would only feed the poison it was a hot summer afternoon and i was carefully inspecting my backpack deciding which toy to bring to the park when my mother appeared at the door of my room her voice startled me i hadnt heard her approach i turned around and saw her standing perfectly framed in the doorway her arms were straight at her sides motionless she wore a blue summer dress with white polka dots the long skirt falling below her knees what mom i didnt hear you she didnt move a muscle then smiled faintly patiently put your shoes on quickly were going out and she left as suddenly as shed appeared i was a bit confused i was sure i still had time to get ready but i was also eager to enjoy the summer day so i forgot about it almost immediately i closed my backpack put on my shoes and joined my mother at the door we walked along the sidewalk passing flowerbeds and trees planted at regular intervals along the edge of the asphalt road their green foliage shielding us from the scorching seasonal sun my mother took a different route than usual which annoyed me i didnt want to go grocery shopping we were supposed to go to the park was that why wed left early mom i complained where are we going now she didnt answer i waited a minute then two finally i decided to ask again more forcefully but i was interrupted when she raised her arm and pointed ahead along the street the bus stop look the bus is coming there were at least fifteen people more than id ever seen waiting there at once the large blue vehicle stopped and started again but to my surprise the number of people didnt change much a man got off but no one boarded mayor stepped off that bus he started down the street when a pair of arms grabbed him from the crowd someone punched him in the stomach and he bent over coughing gasping for air someone else shoved him to the ground and soon the crowd was on him like a pack of beasts on prey people i saw walking the streets every day now fell upon him with animal violence their faces seemed to lose their humanity they screamed and grunted and growled stripped of all dignity the crowd parted and mayor was lifted from the ground and forced to his knees two men gripping his arms behind him his face was swollen and bleeding his lip was split he tried to fill his lungs with air but he could barely breathe let alone struggle his body convulsed with tremors someone emerged from the crowd i knew him a plumber who worked in town my father had once called him to fix our bathroom and afterward theyd had a coffee together before leaving hed smiled and ruffled my hair he stepped forward now holding a hammer he struck mayors face once twice three times blood and shattered teeth sprayed across the sidewalk mayor screamed he tried to close his mouth but the bloody ruins that had been his teeth only made it hurt even more when touching white stumps and torn gums tears streamed down his sunken cheeks mixing with the blood flowing from his lips red droplets fell to the ground in an uneven rhythm i was paralyzed no i was afraid to move it felt like i had fallen into a hallucination or a terrible nightmare and i didnt want to find out by moving that it was real i realized my mother was no longer holding my hand when i saw her walking ahead of me toward the scene step after step echoed on the pavement then at one point one of her steps didnt touch the ground as if it were the most natural thing in the world she rose into the air the next step took her even higher she climbed upward as if ascending an invisible staircase she rose through the air until she was suspended above the crowd like an angelic apparition a sudden summer breeze moved her hair to the side her polkadotted dress fluttered like a flag on a pole she slowly turned her head toward me it wasnt my mothers face it was the face of an old man twisted into an incomprehensible grin no beard no eyebrows his forehead was full of folds like wet cloth and extended beyond where her hairline should have been her new face had erased part of her hair which continued only behind the line of her ear the sun behind her illuminated her delicate feminine figure making her appear even more surreal below the plumber delivered one last blow this time to the temple mayors head fell forward heavily and the men holding his arms let him drop to the ground after that moment my memory becomes vague again im certain i hid in the park in one of the clearings hidden by leaves and brambles a policeman called my name and caught my attention i emerged from my hiding place and saw the sun setting he told me my parents were very worried they cried when they found me i cant remember anything else i dont know if i ever told anyone what i saw or what i said to my parents yesterday i called my mother i asked if she remembered ever calling the police to look for me after a second of silence she laughed oh of course that time you were so impatient to go to the park that you went by yourself i had a panic attack when i went into your room and you werent there and no one heard you leave why are you thinking about that now i never found any news about mayors death
